- Cover Letter
- Resume
- CV
- Portfolio
- Appendix
- Legal

# Cover Letter

Last Revision: YYYY/MM/DD
---

## Contact Information

NAME: First L.
RESIDENCE: City, Province, Country
PHONE NUMBER: 1 (111) 111-1111
EMAIL ADDRESS: firstl@domain (PREFERRED)

## Message

Hello,

	This is where the letter paragraphs go.

Regards,
 
First, L.
---

# Resume

Last Revision: YYYY/MM/DD

### $piece_title
| $start_date - $completion_date

---

# Appendix
---

## Glossary of Terms, Abbreviations, and Acronyms

### Badge

In education, a badge (also referred to as a digital badge) is a digital record of academic achievement, which denotes the completion of an educational program, course, or exercise by a student. Badges are designed to be shared, and may also support being embedded into other pages.

### Career Portfolio

A career portfolio is a portfolio constructed for showcasing one's abilities to employers.

### Certificate

In education, a certificate is a record of academic achievement, in the form of a document, which denotes the completion of an educational program, or course by a student.

### Certification

A certification is a record, typically in the form of a document, of being certified as competent in a particular act, or skillset. When an organization certifies someone, it means they are vouching for that person's abilities. Certifications are usually awarded upon the completion of a test, or hands-on evaluation. However, some organizations will also provide a complete non-formal educational program to prepare students first. Some professions require certification, meaning the professional must hold certain certifications, by law, to perform that work. The term certificate is sometimes used interchangeably with certification, but certificates do not expire, as they are record of academic accomplishemnt. A certification does expire, after a set amount of time.

### C.E.U.

A C.E.U. (Continuing Education Unit) is a measure of work applied to continuing education courses. It is similar to credit hours.

### Continuing Education

Continuing Education is non-credit (meaning it does not count towards a degree program) formal post-secondary education. The term is commonly used in Canada, and the United States. Continuing education is a form of professional development.

### C.P.D.

C.P.D. (Continuing Professional Development) is non-formal post-secondary education. The term is commonly used in the U.K.

### Cover Letter

A cover letter is an introductory letter, traditionally sent with a resume. In the past, when dropping off resumes in-person was the norm, cover letters were standard to include. Nowadays, a cover letter is typically only provided if it is explicitly requested.

### Credit

In education, credit (also called academic credit) is a measure of time (referred to as credit hours) applied to course work. In for-credit formal education programs, each course is assigned a certain number of credits, and the program as a whole will require the student to complete a certain number of credit hours.

### C.V.

In Canada, a C.V. (Curriculum Vitae) is a document which provides an indepth account of one's professional qualifications. However, in some countries, where the term resume is uncommon, a C.V. refers to a document which provides a concise selective account of one's professional qualifications. In Canada, most job applications expect a resume, but C.V.s are used in some very specific instances.

### Degree

In education, a degree is a record of academic achievement, in the form of a document, which denotes the completion of an educational program. Degree programs are longer than certificate programs.

### Education

Education is an intentional learning process. There are several types of education including: formal education, non-formal education, and informal education. Formal education is education which occurs in schools. On a resume, or a C.V. there is typically a section for listing education. It is typically titled "Education". This section is primarily used for listing formal education, but can be used for other types as well.

### Employee

An employee is person who works for a company, under contract. They are required to perform work as instructed.

### Freelancer

A freelancer is an independent contractor typically hired for projects that take little time to complete.

### Further Education

Further Education is non-credit (meaning it does not count towards a degree program) formal post-secondary education, and non-formal post-secondary education. It refers to professional development courses, or programs. The term further education is commonly used in the U.K.

### Independent Contractor

An independent contractor is a person who is self-employed, but does tasks for companies, or persons, under contract. They may have multiple clients at a time, and a free to perform work in the manner they see fit.

### Intern

In Canada, an intern is a non-employee member of a workplace, who is there to learn. They must still be paid at least minimum wage.

### Licence

In Canada, a licence is a legal grant of permission to perform certain acts. Some professions require licensure, meaning the employee must hold certain licences. The American spelling "license" is often used instead.

### License

In the United States of America, a license is a legal grant of permission to perform certain acts. Some professions require licensure, meaning the employee must hold certain licenses.

### M.O.O.C.

A M.O.O.C. (Massive Open Online Course) is an online course that is self-paced, and has no student limit. Generally M.O.O.C.s are non-formal education, but some continuing education courses/programs are provided in M.O.O.C. form as well.

### P.D.U.

A P.D.U. (Professional Development Unit) is a measure of work applied to professional development courses, and programs. It is similar to credit hours, contact hours, or C.E.U.s.

### Portfolio

A portfolio is a collection of a person's completed works, awards, and relevant documents, used for assessment of their abilities. A career portfolio is a portfolio constructed for showcasing one's abilities to employers.

### Professional Development

Professional development is non-credit (meaning it does not count towards a degree program) formal post-secondary education, non-formal post-secondary education, and other activities undertaken to improve one's professional abilities (e.g., attending conferences). One of the most common forms of professional development is online non-formal education courses, offered as M.O.O.C.s.

### Resume

A resume is a document which provides a concise selective account of one's professional qualifications. It is generally 1-2 pages long, but can be longer for more well qualified persons. When writing a resume it is common practice to exclude items based on recency, relevancy, and overall value.

### Student Intern

In Canada, a student intern is a non-employee member of a workplace, who is there to learn. Unless they are under the age of 18, they must be doing the internship as part of an educational program offered by a school. They are not required to be paid.

### Volunteer

A volunteer is someone who willingly labours for free, at an organization, for the betterment of humanity.
---

# Legal
---
## Copyright Notice

Copyright 2024 &copy; $name, and others.

## Licensing

This document is comprised of elements under multiple licenses.

### Default

Except where otherwise stated, elements of this document are licensed under the Ritchey Permissive License v18 license.

"
Ritchey Permissive License v18

Definitions

Any definitions provided within this license overrule any external definitions.

- Creative Work means material the Licensor is licensing.
- License Author means the legal entities whom created this license.
- Licensee means a legal entity receiving the Creative Work under this license, and accepting the license terms.
- Licensor means the legal entities whom hold Copyright, and related rights, in the Creative Work, and are offering this license, applicable to the Creative Work.
- Material means material which is not part of the Creative Work, or provided by the Licensor to the Licensee. 

Offer

Subject to the terms, and conditions, of this license, the Licensor hereby extends this license to any legal entity, which obtains a copy, or portion, of the Creative Work.

Acceptance

In order to accept this license, the Licensee must be capable of being bound to the entire license, and, by accepting the license, agrees to be.

If any portion of this license is known by the Licensee to have been previously deemed unenforceable, by a court of law, in any applicable jurisdiction, the Licensee cannot accept this license. Furthermore, the Licensee must make an effort to determine this before accepting this license. 

Permissions

The Licensee is granted royalty-free, perpetual (unless otherwise stated), non-exclusive, non-transferable permission to do anything with the Creative Work, which does not violate any part of this license.

Restrictions

- Permissions granted don't include patent rights, with the following exceptions:
  + If sharing the Creative Work verbatim otherwise complies with this license, it can be done even with patented portions present.
- Permissions granted don't apply to trademarks, with the following exceptions: 
  + If sharing the Creative Work verbatim otherwise complies with this license, it can be done even with trademarks present.
- The Creative Work, and any portions of it, must remain solely licensed under this license.

Impositions

If sharing the Creative Work is permitted by this license, when sharing, the Licensee:
- Is solely responsible for any consequences, and any withstanding obligations to the recipient. This includes: non-disclaimed warranties, non-disclaimed guarantees, any representations made, any promises made.

Disclaimer

Regardless of any other applicable information, the Creative Work is provided as is, without any warranties, guarantees, promises, or representations. The Licensor will not be liable for loss of any kind, damage of any kind, illness, injury, death, or infringement caused by the Licensee's use of the Creative Work. Any use of the Creative Work is done at the Licensee's own risk.

In the event of legal action, in relation to the Creative Work, neither the Licensor, or Licensee may be compensated by, or required to make compensation to, the other.

Revocation

This license is automatically revoked permanently from the Licensee upon breach of the license terms, with the following exceptions:
- If the Licensee breaches the terms of this license accidentally, the license is revoked, but the Licensee may accept the license again after 30 days, if the Licensee makes all changes needed to come into compliance with the license terms.

If the Licensee has already accepted the license, and later discovers any portion has been deemed unenforceable, by a court of law, in any applicable jurisdiction, the Licensee is not permitted to initiate any new attempts to exercise the license, but is not required to take any action in regards to previously initiated exercises.

Governance

This license is governed by the laws of the province of British Columbia, and the applicable federal laws of Canada. Any legal proceedings in relation to the Creative Work may only occur in the courts of British Columbia, or the Federal Court of Canada. 

Legal proceedings may not consider any optional legal precedents established after April 21, 1989, unless they help protect the defendant.

Interpretation

If any portions of this license contradict, the later portion shall overrule the previous, to the extent needed to make the later portion functional.

Meta

The License Author isn't a party to the licensing agreement between the Licensor, and Licensee. The License Author will not be liable for loss of any kind, damage of any kind, illness, injury, death, or infringement caused by use of this license by either the Licensor, or Licensee.

The license text is provided under the terms of this license.
"

### Personal Information

Personal information within this document is hereby licensed under the Ritchey Sensitive Data License v2 license.

"
Ritchey Sensitive Data License v2:

Subject to the terms of this license, any legal entity who receives material licensed under this license, from a job applicant, is granted royalty-free, temporary, non-exclusive permission to internally use, and internally distribute the material, where it is vital to the hiring process.

The material, as well as all copies made of it, must be destroyed within 30 days of when the job applicant is no longer involved the hiring process.

Retaining the material after becoming aware of these terms constitutes agreement to this license.
"

The material, as well as all copies made of it, must be destroyed within 30 days of when the job applicant is no longer involved the hiring process.

Retaining the material after becoming aware of these terms constitutes agreement to this license.
